intro: Echinospermum tenue, commonly known as the slender echinosperm, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought-resistant adaptations. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces achenes with pappus structures for wind dispersal. The species is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with limited rainfall.
